title: Construction Vehicles Quiz
description: Dig into your memory and recall facts about bulldozers, cranes, and other construction vehicles

questions.question: A 'bulldozer' is primarily used at construction sites for what purpose?
options: Pushing large quantities of earth and debris

questions.question: An 'excavator' is a heavy machine equipped with a long arm and what at the end?
A 'cement mixer truck' has a large rotating drum. Why does the drum rotate?
options: To keep the concrete from hardening during transport

questions.question: A 'tower crane' is a tall structure commonly seen at what type of construction project?
What is the primary function of a 'backhoe loader'?
options: Digging and loading material (combines a front loader and rear excavator)

questions.question: A 'dump truck' is designed to transport and unload what?
options: Loose materials like sand, gravel, or dirt

questions.question: A 'road roller' (or steamroller) is used to do what?
Which construction vehicle is also known as a 'front-end loader' or 'wheel loader'?
A 'pile driver' is used at construction sites for what purpose?
options: Driving structural support piles into the ground

questions.question: A 'motor grader' is typically used for what type of work?
options: Creating flat surfaces and grading roads

questions.question: The brand 'Caterpillar' (CAT) is one of the world's largest manufacturers of what?
A 'skid-steer loader' (like a Bobcat) is a small, versatile vehicle known for what ability?
A 'concrete pump truck' uses a long boom to do what?
options: Deliver liquid concrete to hard-to-reach areas on site

questions.question: A 'trencher' is a construction vehicle used to dig what?
options: Narrow trenches for pipes, cables, or drainage

questions.question: A 'wrecking ball' was traditionally suspended from which type of construction vehicle?
